line_1: "And am, when sober and when mellow,
There in trances profound our philosopher mellow
line_2: Lay all night in the snow consulting his pillow.

line_1: And tulips streaked with colours rich and mellow,
To keep up the Metaphor, 'twould make him mellow,
line_2: And of a sour Stoic, a pleasant young Fellow;

line_1: Wou'd a little too oft get a little too mellow.
line_2: HONEST William, an easy and good-natur'd fellow,

line_1: When thou was corn't, an' I was mellow,
line_2: We took the road ay like a Swallow:

line_1: When thou was corn't, an' I was mellow,
line_2: At Brooses thou had ne'er a fellow,

line_1: When thou was corn't, an' I was mellow,
line_2: But ev'ry tail thou pay't them hollow,
